definition: servile and bending the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor

sentences.english: Humanity is still to groan under the slavery of ornament.
sentences.chinese: 人类还要在装饰面前奴颜婢膝。

sentences.english: Spend as little time on the means as possible consistent with achieving the end. Only idiots live to work.
sentences.chinese: 但得明了，无做到在奴颜婢膝的同时又能出自我。

definition: to bow and bend the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself
to fawn on/to ingratiate oneself/(literary) to meet face to face
bowed head and ears glued (idiom); docile and obedient/at sb's beck and call
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
to bow and scrape/to act servilely
lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
